intro.intro_1:
Mom died last month. 
 Or maybe it was the month before.
intro.intro_2:
In any case, it's time to sell the family house, 
 a little dwelling in the suburbs.
intro.intro_3: I haven't set a foot there in years.

level1.ball_right: Mom scold me every time I play around her flower pots. She really love those things!
level1.ball_callback_right: Darn! The ball is punctured. That cartridge put me in the mood for some kicking.
level1.cartridge_left: Amazing games about ninjas who play soccer to save the world. You can borrow it if you like.
level1.cartridge_right: Super Ninja Soccer Star Warrior 3 for NES! I loved this game!
level1.memory_trigger: This place hasn't changed at all. I feel... like a child.
level1.door_left: I'm not done playing. If I get inside the house now, mom will make me to do my homework!
level1.pot_left: Mom loves this stupid plant. She says one day it will overgrow its own pot. What a ridiculous thought!
level1.pot_right: It would be moderately inconvenient to get through this stupid plant! I should've destroyed it when I had the chance.
level1.radio_right: Dad used to hear some lousy folk music in this radio.
level1.window_right: I can barely see through the glasses. They are really dirty.
level1.pots_left: I can't practice my powerful tiger shot with all these lame pots in the way!
level1.pots_right: My mother sure loved plants. I remember I used to feel jealous of a succulent.
level1.trash_right: This place is in pretty bad shape. I guess selling this house won't be easy.
level1.stone_right: Why did my mother had a boulder in the middle of the frontyard? I never understood that woman.
level1.branches_right: I hope this isn't one of those branching stories.

level2.clock_left: Mom and Dad won't come home for a while.
level2.clock_right: I have spent enough time watching this clock, hoping it will move faster.
level2.cookies_left: Best to put these cookies away. I don't wanna get grounded for life!
level2.couch_left: We have this couch in case a guest wants to watch us have dinner.
level2.couch_right: Dad insisted on buying this third couch. It was preposterous.
level2.couchs_left: Since I moved the TV to my room, these couchs are hardly used. Mom and Dad aren't the "sit and chit chat over a cup of coffee" type.
level2.couchs_right: Every stain in these couchs tells a story. A sticky and smelly tale, in most cases.
level2.cupboard_left: The family's cupboard. It seems that Dad's hidden whisky bottle has been working after hours lately. Just like him!
level2.cupboard_right: Can't remember why did we put these old phonebooks up here?
level2.cupboard_full_left: Now the cupboard is full of crumbs. Mom said I clean up the table, didn't mention anything about getting dirty other stuff.
level2.cupboard_open_right: The rat seems to have gotten attached to her cupboard's spot. At least SOMEONE managed to find some happiness in this house.
level2.door_left: Don't be a spoilsport! It's too early to go to bed.
level2.door_right: This door is jammed. I remember there was a trick to open it... How was it?
level2.joystick_right: My old joystick! It still has the marks of my bites on it. Damned "Nintendo hard game"!.
level2.coffeemug_left: I'm not allowed to drink coffee. I wish I was an adult so I could do whatever I want!
level2.note_right: It's an old note that reads: "I left you some snacks over the table. Do not forget to clean everything up once you are done!" -Mom
level2.phone_left: Mom said I can only call her in case of an emergency.
level2.phone_right: I do not understand how there can be people who still use these wicked machines?!
level2.phone_ring_left: MOM: Stop playing games! Go to your room and do your homework. Your dad jammed the door out of rage. Remember holding X, Y and B while opening.
level2.phone_ring_right: So... holding X, Y and B while opening. Mom sure called from work to tell me the weirdest stuff.
level2.phonebook_right: My mother's phonebook. Her office's number has been written on its first page since I can remember.
level2.picture_family_left: Dad, Mom and me portrayed in probably the last time we were all in the same room over the last two years
level2.picture_family_right: I remember the day we took that picture. We needed to finish the cammera roll.
level2.rat_right: Something seems to be trapped under this huge rat... But she's ravenous! Better not disturb her.
level2.pot_left: Mom put this flowerpot here so I can't play soccer inside the house.
level2.pot_right: When I send mom to the retirement home, I remember she took this flower with her in a tiny pot.

level3.car1_left: This is my favorite toy car!
level3.car2_left: My Mom picked this one for me. She clearly didn't know a thing about toy cars... or even me!
level3.car2_right: I didn't like this car's girlie color, but it's actually nice.
level3.chest_left: My parents are always asking me to put my toys and games away! They say they distract me from my duties.
level3.chest_right: Like all the fun things in this house, my old toys and games were constantly kept under lock!
level3.drawer_left: My best marbles, my walkie-talkie, my Pokemon stickers. All safe and sound in my nightstand.
level3.drawer_right: I used to keep my most beloved stuff in here. And I did well, they are still in perfect shape!
level3.library_left: Mom and Dad won't come home 'til midnight, again. So I'm not really in a rush to do my homework.
level3.library_right: "Alice in Blunderland", "The Racist Duckling", "Choose Your Own Advertisement"... These were some really crappy children's books.
level3.tv_left: Oh, it's almost time for Dragon Ball Z! But better don't get distracted...
level3.tv_ready_left: I don't wanna watch TV. I want to play videogames!
level3.bed_left: I'm not a baby! It's too early to go to sleep.
level3.bed_right: The wood looks rotten and it's full of bedbugs. I won't lie on it.
level3.window_left: I can see Mr. Novell's house from here. Hi, Mr. Novell!
level3.window_right: Mr. Novell's house was tear down after he became crazy and killed all those cats. Now there's a brewery pub there.
